page.title: 08THE CHURCH AT CHURCH FENTON
page.content: The church is 750 years old.It is shaped like Jesus' cross with the tower in the middle.This{cruciform {structure}is rare in this area and the tower is very large for such a small church.The tower was built in 1450.It is supported by four stone pillars and inside one is a stone spiral staircase leading to the belfry.In the belfry are{three bells;}one strikes every half hour.In each corner of the tower there is a red light to warn low flying aeroplanes.These are needed because there is an RAF base nearby.The south wall is moving outwards and repairs are needed.The church is built of{limestone.}The roof is slate but the tower roof is made of lead and straw.There is no vandalism so the church is left open.
